instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?01 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short
threads.message:
Hi all,

got a no power <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.

history is that it just stopped working, no signs of any liquid, Board is perfect. I get 20v on the charger so 3V3 is OK but 0 amps being drawn and 0v on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

i removed the fuse and get a 3.3ohm short to ground on pin 2.

looking around the only possible sign I saw was <CAPACITOR>C7754</CAPACITOR> (cap for <SIGNAL>PP1V_OPC_S0</SIGNAL>) that had a solder ball by it. I removed it but same situation.

i injected voltage at 5v into pin 2 but no amp draw and definitely nothing hot.

any ideas?

thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?01 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short
threads.message: Remove CPU heat sink at 3.3 ohms to ground something must get hot. Could very well be the CPU. Inspect closely to all caps as well.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?01 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short
threads.message:
Why people still inject tension without basic tests???
5V could went to CPU and killed it.

Any big coil has the same value to ground as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?01 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short
threads.message:
All big coils are measuring in kohms except CPU VCORE which is around 3ohm. Even with heat sink removed still nothing hot.
Sounding like a dead CPU, will take note on injecting voltage above 2 for PPBUS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?01 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short
threads.message: In this case, I?ve seen many many dead CPUs on the newer USBC models where PPBUS is shorted in the die of the PCH. So it doesn?t surprise me one bit if that?s what heats first here

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?01 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Short
threads.message:
At least one high-side MOSFET from CPU power supplies is shorted.
You've injected 5V directly into CPU; it is trash now.
